(2) Summary

In this presentation we look at how to move a discussion from talking about individual and isolated technical problems, to understanding and addressing the big picture. This can help when conversations seem to be stuck at discussing technical details, and when the goal is to move the conversation forward to be about the actual business goals. We're looking at some conversational strategies and at typical responses during these conversations. The main goal of this maneuver is to re-frame the initial discussion in a way that better addresses the underlying business goals and that has the ability to scale.



Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(5) Watch out for Disappointment



From How to What to Why Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(6) How are things going?

  • Initial conversations often start with technical problems or goals
  • Walk up the chain from implementation to plan to strategy
  • Are we building a product that will be a useful digital product?
    • Every API is a product because it can be used in digital value chains


From How to What to Why Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(7) What are you trying to achieve?

  • APIs never are the end goal
  • Digital transformation is much more than just APIs
    • You need to build the right APIs
    • You need to manage them right
    • The organization needs to be capable to leverage them


From How to What to Why Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(8) Why are you trying to achieve this?

  • Good Leadership Is About Communicating Why [https://hbr.org/2020/05/good-leadership-is-about-communicating-why]
  • Strategy should be known and owned by everybody
  • APIs will not transform an organization; a transformed organization will be API-centric


From How to What to Why Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(9) Strategy Deep Dive

Vision without execution is hallucination. (Thomas Edison [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Edison])


From How to What to Why Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(10) API Strategy Structure [http://dret.net/lectures/webinar-2020/strategy#strategy-matrix]

External Internal
Biz
  • API monetization
  • Revenue-supporting APIs
  • Increase speed & feedback
  • Identify & stabilize enablers
  • Design for externalization
  • Increase biz insight with dashboards
Org
  • Focus on documentation/DX
  • Support discovery/self-service
  • Collect DX feedback
  • Products > projects (ownership)
  • Team enablement/support
  • Loose coupling for speed/agility
Tech
  • Tech trends and popularity
  • Invest in on-boarding support
  • Secure through platform
  • Loosely coupled implementations
  • Observe patterns and practices
  • Establish C4E for platform/support

(19) The Big Five

  • API Strategy â How does it relate to other strategy?
  • API Management â Narrow and technical or full product lifecycle?
  • Platforms â Technical foundations or the business model?
  • Integration â Loose coupling or tight coupling?
  • Open API â Open APIs for general consumption or OAI?


Understanding: What Do You Mean? Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(20) The Meaning of Words

The meaning of a word is its use in the language. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosophical_Investigations#Meaning_is_use] (Ludwig Wittgenstein [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_Wittgenstein], Philosophical Investigations [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosophical_Investigations], 1953)
  • There is no abstract meaning that a word then references
  • Communication establishes the meaning and makes the word usable and useful


Conclusions

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale

(22) Focus on the Long Game

  • Look at everything within the bigger context
  • Never be afraid to ask what the goal is and why
  • Always keep in mind that everything digital needs to scale
  • Watch out for lack of vision (rarely) and strategy (routinely)


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): The Why/What/How Maneuver: From Start to Scale
